sense.name: (Cause to) navigate in loops.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] LOOP NP2[patient] NP1[theme] LOOP PP[directional] Note: Does NOT include fastening as a result of the navigation.
sense.examples: The bicycle looped around the tree. The stunt pilot looped his plane. He looped around the party a few times before asking her to dance.

sense.name: Wind around, fasten, or join with a loop.
sense.commentary: Note: Must imply an object capable of fastening or wrapping by virtue of the looping action.
sense.examples: He looped his watch through his belt. Loop those ropes and set them on the deck. She looped the ribbon through her daughter's hair.
